facts.text: Appellant in C.A. 1789/69 entered service as a teacher in a private aided school on March 14, 1946.
Both appellants in C.A. 1790/69 originally joined service as teachers in aided schools but entered government school service on August 17, 1958 and December 13, 1948 respectively.
Appellant in C.A. 1791/69 joined government service as a teacher and attained the age of 55 on July 2, 1968.

On November 22, 1965, all associations of government and private aided school teachers, of which the appellants were members, submitted a memorandum to the government making various demands, including raising the age of retirement to 60 years.

On July 14, 1966, the government issued an order raising the age of retirement from 55 to 58 years effective from 1-7-1966 for all teachers including Head Masters of aided schools, subject to conditions allowing retirement at 55 with approval or voluntary retirement.
The July 14, 1966 order was followed by an amendment in the Kerala Education Rules.

On May 4, 1967, the government issued an order in supersession of previous orders, lowering the age of compulsory retirement to 55 years for all government employees and aided school teachers whose age was 58 under existing orders, with a grace period for those who had crossed 55 or would within three months.
Necessary amendments were made in Kerala Education Rules under Act 6 of 1959 and Kerala Service Rules under Article 309.
Appellant in C.A. 1789/69 exercised the option under Rule 2 of Chapter XXVII-B read with Rule 4 to be governed by those rules, making his retirement age same as government school teachers.
Exhibit P-6: Proceedings of District Education Officer, Kottayam dated March 10, 1967, mentioning raising age to 58 and listing teachers allowed to continue till 58 subject to suitability.
Exhibit P-7: Proceedings of District Educational Officer, Palghat, listing teachers to continue beyond 55 after July 14, 1966 order.

legal_issues.text: Whether the appellant in C.A. 1789/69 is entitled to retirement age of 60 years under Rule 8 of Chapter XXVII-A as he was in service prior to 4-9-1957, or is bound by Chapters XXVII-B and XIV C setting age at 55 like government teachers.
Whether government orders raising then lowering retirement age created a binding agreement, contract, or estoppel preventing reduction to 55 years.
Whether Exhibits P-6 and P-7 or Rules 5 and 6 of Kerala Service Rules prevent reduction of retirement age to 55.

petitioner_arguments.text: Provisions of Chapters XXVII-A and B are not mutually exclusive; appellant in C.A. 1789/69 entitled to benefit of Rule 8 in Chapter XXVII-A for 60 years retirement as in service prior to 4-9-1957.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Rule 8 Chapter XXVII-A Kerala Education Rules

petitioner_arguments.text: Government orders following teachers' memorandum constitute binding agreement or contract from which government cannot unilaterally resile; alternatively, estoppel applies.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Article 309 Constitution; principles from Union of India v. Indo-Afghan Agencies

petitioner_arguments.text: Exhibits P-6 and P-7 allowed continuation beyond 55 till 58.
Rules 5 and 6 of Kerala Service Rules protect existing conditions and prevent disadvantageous changes without consent.

respondent_arguments.text: Chapters XXVII-A and XXVII-B are mutually exclusive; appellant in aided school under Chapter XXVII-B has same retirement age as government teachers i.e. 55.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Rule 4 Chapter XXVII-B; Rule 2(a) Chapter XIV C Kerala Education Rules

respondent_arguments.text: No agreement or contract fetters government's power under Article 309 or Section 12 Act 6 of 1959; no estoppel as no detrimental reliance on representation.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Article 309 Constitution; Section 12 Kerala Education Act 1958

court_reasoning.text: Chapters XXVII-A and XXVII-B mutually exclusive; appellant in C.A. 1789/69 opted for Chapter XXVII-B, thus retirement age same as government teachers at 55; cannot claim Rule 8 of XXVII-A.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Clear wording of rules relegates aided school teacher opting for XXVII-B to position of government school teacher.

court_reasoning.text: No binding agreement or contract from memorandum and orders; government's rule-making power under Article 309 and Section 12 Act 6/1959 cannot be fettered; no estoppel as no representation acted upon to detriment.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Conditions of service can be changed under constitutional and statutory powers.

court_reasoning.text: Exhibits P-6 and P-7 predate lowering order; change in retirement rules valid, does not attract Articles 311 or 14.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Cites Bishun Narain Mishra v. State of UP for validity of retirement rule changes.

court_reasoning.text: Rules 5 and 6 of Kerala Service Rules do not prevent reduction as they apply to rules coming into force, not subsequent amendments.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Power to amend service rules exists.

holdings.text: Appellant in aided school opting under Chapter XXVII-B has compulsory retirement age of 55 years same as government school teachers.
Government not bound by alleged agreement or estoppel; retirement age can be validly lowered.
Rules 5 and 6 do not bar reduction of retirement age; Exhibits P-6 and P-7 ineffective post-lowering order.

precedents_cited.case_name: Union of India Ors. v. M/s. Indo-Afghan Agencies Ltd.
precedents_cited.relevance: Estoppel from government representation in export scheme not applicable here as no detrimental reliance.

precedents_cited.case_name: Bishun Narain Mishra v. State of Uttar Pradesh Others
precedents_cited.relevance: Change in rule relating to retirement valid, does not attract Art. 311 or 14.

statutes_cited.name: Kerala Education Act, 1958 (Act 6 of 1959)
statutes_cited.relevance: Conditions of service including retirement age prescribed by government; power to make rules.

statutes_cited.name: Kerala Education Rules, 1959
statutes_cited.relevance: Govern retirement age for aided school teachers; options and applicability to government school ages.

statutes_cited.name: Kerala Service Rules
statutes_cited.relevance: Protect existing rights but do not prevent subsequent amendments to service conditions.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Power to make service rules; changes do not violate unless specified.

outcome.summary: Appeals by special leave dismissed affirming Kerala High Court judgment dismissing writ petitions; appellants' retirement age fixed at 55 years as per May 4, 1967 order and rules.

key_quotes.text: The provisions of Chapters XXVIIA and XXVIIB when read together leave no doubt that the two chapters are mutually exclusive.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core reasoning rejecting petitioner's claim to dual benefits.

key_quotes.text: The power of the government under Art. 309 of the Constitution to make rules regulating the conditions of service... could in no way be fettered by any agreement.
key_quotes.speaker: court
